You are given two sequences of positive integers, A and B, of length n.  Find a subset P of k indices (where k ≤ n) from the sequences such that:

*  2 * (a<sub>p1</sub> + a<sub>p2</sub> + ... + a<sub>pk</sub>) > sum of all elements in A
*  2 * (b<sub>p1</sub> + b<sub>p2</sub> + ... + b<sub>pk</sub>) > sum of all elements in B

Output:

* The size of the subset k
* The k indices p<sub>1</sub>, p<sub>2</sub>, ..., p<sub>k</sub> 



Note:  The indices in P must be distinct.  A solution always exists.

You are given two lists of numbers. Find the largest number of elements you can select from each list so that the sum of twice the selected elements from the first list is greater than the sum of all elements in the first list, and the sum of twice the selected elements from the second list is greater than the sum of all elements in the second list.
